action.action-desc: Ms. Slotkin (for herself and Mrs. Miller-Meeks) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to direct the Secretary concerned to carry out training on the consequences of committing a crime in preseparation counseling of the Transition Assistance Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Crime Doesn’t Pay Act of 2022.

section.header: Training on consequences of committing a crime in preseparation counseling of the Transition Assistance Program

subsection.text: Subsection (b) of section 1142 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Training regarding the consequences to such a member who is convicted of a crime, specifically regarding the loss of benefits from the Federal Government to such member.

subsection.text: The Secretary concerned shall carry out paragraph (20) of such subsection, as added by subsection (a), not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
The Secretary of Defense shall develop the training under such paragraph.

Not later than 180 days after the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall provide a briefing to the Committees on Armed Services of the Senate and House of Representatives regarding progress of the Secretary in preparing the training under such paragraph.
